New Records: The Celtics match an NBA record with 29 3-pointers in a win vs. the Knicks.
Key Match Events: Jayson Tatum scored 37 points and made eight of the Celtics' NBA record-tying 29 3-pointers.
Derrick White scored 24 points, Jaylen Brown added 23 and Tatum had 10 assists.
Jalen Brunson scored 22 points for New York, and new addition Karl-Anthony Towns had just 12 points and seven rebounds.
The Celtics led by as many as 35 points before missing their last 13 3-point attempts while trying to break the record.
Pre-Game Insights: The new-look Knicks were supposed to be the biggest threat to the Celtics in the Eastern Conference, but even after adding Towns and Mikal Bridges over the summer, they were no match for the team that finished 14 games in front last season.
On July 28, U.S. Olympic basketball coach Steve Kerr benched Tatum for a game against Serbia, guaranteeing Tatum would be motivated for the Celtics’ title defense.
Miscellaneous Highlights: With the Celtics leading by more than 20 points early in the third quarter, the TD Garden crowd’s attention strayed from the basketball game and it began chanting 'Yankees Suck!'

The Celtics hit their 29th 3-pointer early in the fourth quarter, then fired up two long airballs and 13 misses in a row from beyond the arc as they went for the record set in 2020 by Milwaukee. The crowd chanted 'One more 3!' in the final minutes, but on Boston's last possession Payton Pritchard dribbled out the shot clock without making another attempt.
Others: The Celtics visit Washington on Thursday and the Knicks play their home opener against Indiana on Friday.
